intro: Tinospora berneyi, commonly known as the Indian moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by berry-like fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Tinospora berneyi is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and ecological studies.
